meanings.definition: Relating to or involving tropes or figures of speech.
meanings.sent1: Her tropological language made the story more interesting.
meanings.sent2: The poet's tropological style added depth to his verses.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's tropological explanation of the lesson made the students smile.
meanings.sent4: His tropological approach to storytelling painted vivid pictures in the listeners' minds.
meanings.sent5: The tropological descriptions in the book made the scenes come alive.

meanings.definition: Using or characterized by tropes or figures of speech.
meanings.sent1: The writer's tropological skills were evident in her use of metaphors.
meanings.sent2: His tropological speech captivated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's tropological jokes had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: She had a tropological way of expressing her emotions through words.
meanings.sent5: The tropological elements in the play added layers of meaning to the dialogue.
